I don't understand edible plastic.

The reason people package food content in plastic is to protect the content from whatever dirt and bugs that it can pick up from the environment. And the reason people use single use plastic is because it's convenient to not have to carry around empty packaging once you've consumed the content.

Edible plastic would be totally missing the point of using plastic, as you probably don't want to eat edible plastic that's been touching the bottom of the backpack that you've probably never cleaned since you bought it three years ago.

So, you're going to carry this edible plastic... in another layer of single use plastic. So what are we really saving here?

How about using natural packaging? In some Asian countries, it's quite common to use leaves such as those from banana, palm, or bamboo as single use food packaging. Basically you just take the leaf, clean them, cut into size, then wrap your food in it. Once you're done, throw away the leaves in your green bin, and it will decompose with the rest of your uneaten veggies.
